evidence_span: poor corrosion properties in BWR environment and in the simulating autoclave tests at $5 0 0 \mathrm { ‰}$ is associated with large second-phase particles

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_011_chunk3
evidence_span: a higher silicon content corresponds to better corrosion resistance

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_011_chunk3
evidence_span: A higher iron content seems also to be associated with better corrosion behavior

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_011_chunk3
evidence_span: better corrosion resistance is associated with higher iron content in the matrix

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_011_chunk3
evidence_span: Differences in volume fraction of recrystallized grains within the range of 5 to $15 \%$ , as encountered in practice, do not seem to have a significant influence on the corrosion behavior

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_011_chunk3
evidence_span: fully recrystallized material is known to show better corrosion properties than stress relief annealed material with a much higher dislocation density

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_011_chunk4
evidence_span: Increased matrix content of silicon and perhaps iron seems to be beneficial for the corrosion resistance.

evidence_span: Increasing the annealing parameter from 2.3×10⁻¹⁸ to 29×10⁻¹⁸ h improved the corrosion resistance of unannealed cold-worked tubes

evidence_span: cumulative annealing parameter greater than 10⁻¹⁸ h is sufficient to provide uniformly good corrosion resistance in Zircaloy-4
